intro: Clidemia brachystephana, commonly known as the short-stemmed mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the leaf axils. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Clidemia brachystephana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
